week_overview: This week focuses on building your aerobic base with consistent easy running and one dedicated long run. Strength work will support your running form and resilience.

running_sessions.workout_description: An easy-paced run to kick off the week. Focus on maintaining a conversational pace, enjoying the movement, and building your aerobic base.
running_sessions.notes: Keep your effort level low, you should be able to hold a full conversation.

running_sessions.workout_description: Another easy run, slightly longer to gradually increase your weekly volume. Concentrate on smooth, relaxed running.
running_sessions.notes: Listen to your body, if you feel tired, don't be afraid to slow down.

running_sessions.workout_description: Your key long run for the week. Maintain a comfortable, easy pace throughout. This run is crucial for developing endurance and mental toughness.
running_sessions.notes: Fuel adequately before and consider carrying water/electrolytes if needed. The goal is to finish strong, not fast.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats
exercises.form_cues: Keep your chest up, push your hips back as if sitting in a chair, and ensure your knees track over your toes.

exercises.name: Walking Lunges
exercises.form_cues: Step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at approximately a 90-degree angle. Keep your torso upright.

exercises.name: Push-ups
exercises.form_cues: Maintain a straight line from head to heels. Lower your chest towards the floor, keeping elbows close to your body. Modify with knee push-ups if needed.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.form_cues: Engage your core, keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, avoid sagging hips or piking up.

exercises.name: Glute Bridges
exercises.form_cues: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat. Lift your hips off the ground by squeezing your glutes until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.

exercises.name: Bird-Dog
exercises.form_cues: Start on all fours. Extend opposite arm and leg simultaneously, keeping your core stable and back flat. Avoid rotating your hips.
